title: Iranian woman detained after taking clothes off at university in Tehran
byline: A female student stripped to her underwear outside her university in Iran in what some student and rights groups say was a protest against the country’s strict Islamic dress code.

title: MPs will not be able to appoint family members to their personal staff soon: PM
byline: MPs will not be able to appoint their family members as their personal staff under the new government, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said over the weekend.

title: Unclear law on food and drinks leaves candidates hungry for engagement
byline: The ambiguous rules surrounding food and drink during elections have placed considerable challenges on candidates, preventing them from offering even simple items like bottled water and refreshments to voters, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: SL well-positioned to attract 2.9 mn tourists
byline: Following the expected under-performance in the tourism sector this year, Sri Lanka’s tourism is poised to reach new heights with tourist arrivals projected to reach 2.9 million generating US$ 5.4 billion income.

title: Health Ministry to allot few experienced F&D Inspectors: Dr. Ananda Wijewickrama
byline: The Ministry of Health has agreed to assign a few experienced Food and Drug Inspectors to revive the operations of the now-defunct law enforcement division of the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA), which is responsible for all the drug raids in the country, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: CPC earns profit but struggles to operate independently amid foreign competition
byline: Even though the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has started earning profits, it is unable to operate independently due to the presence of other foreign petroleum companies operating in the country, Petroleum Storage Terminals Limited (CPSTL) Chairman D.J.A.S  De S. Rajakaruna said.

title: 36 dead after overcrowded bus skids into deep gorge in northern India
byline: A poorly maintained and overcrowded bus veered off the road and plunged into a deep gorge in northern India on Monday, killing at least 36 people and injuring several others, officials said.

title: Immigration proposes to link up with hotels to track down tourist information
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration has proposed to link up with the tourist hotels in future as a practical means to track down information on foreign tourists visiting from seven countries that do not require a visa to enter or remain in Sri Lanka, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: No future recovery of expenses from people for illegally built filling stations
byline: In the future, no opportunity will be provided to recover expenses from people for illegally built filling stations, Ceylon Petroleum Storage Terminals Limited (CPSTL) Chairman D.J.A.S De S. Rajakaruna said.

title: Online system for passport applications from November 6
byline: The public is requested to use the Department of Immigration & Emigration’s online system, launching on November 6, to apply for passports.

title: NPP never made allegations of hidden money in Uganda: Tilvin
byline: NPP member Tilvin Silva refuted making any allegations of hidden money in Uganda, while saying that such claims were made by the SJBers.

title: Confusion still reigns on Arugam Bay issue: Ruwan
byline: There is confusion with regard to the situation in Arugam Bay as there seems to be two schools of thought as to who was planning to stage an attack, UNP Deputy Leader and National Democratic Front (NDF) candidate Ruwan Wijewardene said.

title: Chinese astronauts return to earth after 6-month stint in space station
byline: Three Chinese astronauts who spent six months developing China’s low orbit space station returned to Earth safely early Monday, the China Manned Space Agency (CMSA) said

title: NPP not expecting unlimited power like 5/6th majority: Tilvin
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) does not expect an unlimited power like that of a 5/6th majority in Parliament deactivating the opposition, NPP member Tilvin Silva said today.

title: No price revisions on Litro, Laugfs LP gas
byline: Litro Gas Lanka Limited and Laugfs Gas PLC have decided not to revise their retail price of a cylinder of 12.5 kg LP gas in response to the recent fuel price revision.

title: Trial date set for Diana Gamage’s forged documents case
byline: The case filed against former State Minister Diana Gamage for allegedly obtaining a national identity card by submitting forged documents despite being aware that she is not a Sri Lankan citizen, was fixed for trial today by the Colombo High Court.

title: Lohan Ratwatte’s wife remanded over unregistered luxury car
byline: The wife of former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte was remanded till November 7 over the incident of an unregistered luxury vehicle found at her residence in Mirihana.

title: Sunil Jayarathne assumes duties as Civil Aviation Chairman
byline: Additional Director General of Sri Lanka Customs Sunil Jayarathne has been appointed as the Chairman of the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka.

title: SC dismisses petition challenging General Elections date
byline: The Supreme Court dismissed a petition challenging the decision to hold the General Elections on November 14.

title: Sri Lanka Telecom gets new chairman
byline: Sri Lanka Telecom PLC (SLT) has appointed Dr. Mothilal de Silva as the new Chairman of its Board of Directors, effective November 4, 2024.

title: Spain’s king and queen pelted with mud in flood-hit Valencia
byline: The King and Queen of Spain have been pelted with mud and other objects by angry protesters during a visit to flood-hit Valencia.

title: How to vote in 2024 General Elections
byline: As the 2024 General Elections approach, the Election Commission has issued guidelines on how to vote and choose the preferred candidates.

title: Italian and British nationals arrested in Kandy
byline: Two foreign nationals have been arrested by the Kandy Tourism Police for violating visa conditions while staying in Sri Lanka.
